content:
Posted: September 2, 2014



YouTube™ Video: Maplestory Idol 

			Views: 122,163		

			Yeahh don't ask. Audio from : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i3pfsCS7fWI&feature=player_embedded		

An expanded review:This community is cancerous as it gets; don't hang out near henesys at all. Unless of course you're like me and take pleasure from watching 12-14 year olds scream and use leet/tumblr speak constantly, spouting useless trash. Honestly there is sort of alot of content for beginners, but for somebody that has already played this in the past you will notice a huge difference in gameplay. Everything is much easier, to the point that you could probably level a character all the way to about 180 (or somewhere close to that, maybe even past that) without even coming close to dying, there is no strategy, and most classes are pretty much the same besides one or two quirks and some slightly-different looking abilities. Maplestory is simply the type of game that literally takes a step back every update, In 2006 it was a classic 2d sidescrolling action platformer with a bright and quirky style, now it's pretty much a high-maintenence dolled up doppleganger of it's previous self, that being said, you can still find a decent amount of fun in this game, even if it's boring and repetitive.P.S. Some of the music in this game is incredible, particularly Ellinia's or Elluels music, I could listen to it for hours.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 31, 2015
												Some long term players seem to object that this game is good; however, this game is good. I say this with an unbiased view simply because I don't have long term experience affecting what it is now and thus I'm not making that biased comparison. This means I'm giving this review based on the NOW -- reduces review bias/corrupting a review from a nonbiased standpoint.Now that I've said this lets get it started.I started as a Xenon and dove right into the Resistance in which the class begins to take on the persona of it's intended story line. After a few hours of play there seems to be a bigger change that kept making me quit the game in the past. This is the grind is much easier. Now I'm not sure if it's because of the current model or because the Xenon class is quite powerful for an all around class, but it is definitely much more easier to level in the game.If you like Anime and the storyline within Anime then you will quite possibly enjoy the game simply because it has some of that similar style within its dialog -- specifically the Episodes which is a short version of titles like Attack on Titan or Sword Art Online.The only down fall I'd say the game actually has is the navigation system. Now by this I do not mean movement of the character but instead the finding of NPCs for quests that need to be completed is quite hard sometimes. I had to do some google searching to find out where the NPCs for a quest is at so I can complete/begin them. In the end, if you can overlook the fact you level quicker in the game than years ago, and are able to tolerate the fact you may need to do some google searching on where the turn-in NPC is for a quest. Then you're going to enjoy the game so as long you don't dislike sidescroller games, and Anime. If you do dislike, then this game is probably not for you.The graphics are the same as they always were though so no real graphical improvements unless you want to talk effects... Anyways, try the game. If you wonder whether or not the cash shop is expensive or not then I'd like to say it isn't because your money does go pretty far if you spend it wisely. Now, if you don't do cash shop then that is fine because your not really missing anything other than maybe an auto-loot pet and the chance to win some in-game money to give you a good start at earlier levels.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												Maplestory is a pretty fun game to play if you have friends to play with you. I have mixed feelings about post Big Bang Maplestory. While it made the game much easier and a bit of a grind fest, lots of content had been added that makes the grinding feel fun at times. Since I lasted played I've heard they added some features to encourage group play which is also good. Many people say Maplestory is pay to win and it certainly does help; however, you can still get just as far for free. Overall, I'd say Maplestory is a good game to play if you have friends and some spare time. TL;DR: Play with friends 7.5~8/10, Play without friends 6~6.5/10

content:
Posted: March 12, 2015
The GoodNice Art StyleNice music, very fittingLots of content. (35 classes, lots of PQ's and bosses)Game gets updated often. High level cap (250 level cap)The BadThe Community. There is a PQ that gives insane EXP and everyone just does that and nothing else.Game seems poorly optimized often freezing when a lot of players are on screen or you open the map or quest logQuests are what you'd expect. Kill X, Collect Y, bring back to Z.  Nothing new here.Combat can feel very grindy.A bit pay to win. (Although Nexon has been rectifying that lately).Recommend?You'd really have to try it out for yourself and see if you'd like it because it's not a game that everyone likes. I personally have been playing for years and love it.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 16, 2016
												I have played this game for years (since before big bang) so i have been through the ups and downs. The game isnt pay 2 win it is pay 2 save time. Proof below: You can get basic equips through events etc (basic can be even lvl 120 stuff that normal mobs drop or the zakum equips from easy zakum). Then you can do the gollux boss and commerci quest line to sell gollux shop equips by getting coins from easy mode, and cubic blades from commerci. A shop you can aquire from the maple rewards shop by killing bosses if you can, or doing star planet (easily attainable in a few hours from star planet). Sell your gollux shop equips and cubic blades that you acquiered over a month or so, you will be able to make a few hundred mil or so. Buy your chaos root abyss equips. Buy your reinforced gollux pendant / belt. Commerci will give you your already epic'd face and eye equip. Shoe and glove can be obtained by doing normal root abyss and opening the shoe / glove box with coins to achieve the 100% chance to go up tier per cube.  Badge attained through ghost ship questline, emblem through boss arena, rings through the gollux shop (should have sold 1 out of the 4) and the other ring that drops from bosses, earring through gollux shop, cape can be anything until you can afford tyrant cape. Once you attained all of your equips you can epic pot all of them through epic pot scrolls provided in every single event shop  which we have almost 24/7. Once you epic an item you can cube it from using cubes from bosses (since you can boss somewhat now), or cubes from the reward shop (get points from bossing or star planet). Also i forgot about scrolling which can be done through spell traces (20 crusader coins = 100 traces ~ crusader coins dropped from bosses), or event shop scrolls. Thats it, not pay 2 win, pay 2 save yourself from spending time on all of this.

												Keep in mind this is my opinion.  I understand that maplestory is a very different game, and A LOT of people do not enjoy it. I have been playing maplestory for years, I believe it is a very good game.I joined around the release of the pirate, the fifth job/class to the hero Maplestory is a different type of MMO, you don't really do quest all that much in this game, it's always been more of a grind.This can be good, and bad.Early game is encredibly easy in every way, monsters killable, leveling stable/quick, and money isn't a problem.Later on in the game it can be a giant pain, you need funds to buy potions, you need to have "godlike eqps" each bought for tons of IN GAME money.You can play this game without spending a dime, personally I have spent a good bit of money on this game, but I do not regret it.~Pro/ConsPros: cuteeasytime wastercons:end game leveling is roughyou may not like the style of gameplay (grinding)people can be elitest if you don't have specific gear.

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 18, 2016
												Despite being able to run StarCraft II and Eve Online, somehow I am having serious lag issues with this 2D game on my machine.But this review isn't to bash the *game.* This is here to warn users who want to play this game that Nexon's tech support is completely inaccessible.* They cannot be contacted directly.* They have a confusing two sets of forums dedicated to the game.* Signing up for an account does not grant you posting rights, so you cannot post or reply to topics in the forum.* All of their FAQ sections are heavily downvoted by multiple users, and their posts are generally unhelpful.Their support team is completely inaccessible. I cannot reach them in any way shape or form.While some users are experiencing fluid gameplay, others like myself are experiencing major slowdowns and lag that causes them to miss jumps, sustain unpreventable/unavoidable damage, freeze outright, etc. My lag issues are primarily caused by intense CPU and RAM spikes coupled with disk thrashing with minimal background services and programs, leading me to believe the 2D MMO is somehow unoptimized for above-average laptops like a Lenovo G50 with an A8 processor and 6GB of RAM.I've turned all of the graphical settings down, muted sounds, set the .exes to avoid advanced DPI scaling, ran the .exe in 8 bit color mode, tried numerous combinations of compatibility modes for Windows 7 and 8, and this machine is on a lean operation; all of its background services and running programs are cut down for efficiency and performance. My background is in IT. The game shouldn't be demanding half of my RAM on the lowest settings, it is 100% flawed optimization.Again, warning users, the customer support is inaccessible. Nexon is a brick wall with no entry points. If you encounter lag in the game, you are out of luck.

content:
Posted: December 7, 2016
												I played this again out of nostalgia and was curious to see what changed. While the additions were interesting, it didn't take me too long to remember why I stopped playing this in the first place. The gameplay gets stale really quickly since all you're ever doing is hunting down monsters and collecting items. There's really not that much variety to the quests handed to you since it's always one of three things--kill a certain amount of monsters or collect a certain amount of items said monsters have dropped. This is probably why I stopped playing MMOs in general, but there were some that brought a little variety into things. It was a nice trip down memory lane, but I'm not surprised I lost my interest so quickly this time around.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2014
												This game has been on Steam since 2012 I believe. Since then, Nexon has gone through countless updates, time and time again, breaking Steam MS. I was forced to play MS through the website most of the time. This was not the issue. I have been playing MS since a month out of Beta. It was the best thing to happen to me, to date. However, what really got me down was when my friends quit, or I got hacked, or if I was being ks'ed, etc. I remember when Victoria Island was the only continent and there were only 4 Adventurers and HPQ was the only pq. Everything changed after the BB patch. It became SO much easier to level up that anyone could get 120 levels within 24 hours, without 2x EXP. The game changed from being too hard to too easy, it was ridiculous. Now, though, Nexon has finally caught up to all of the demands of the Veterans and have made the game harder to level up from level 30-60 and 170-200, which are the prime levels. After many updates to nerf the OP grind fest and 24 hours max leveling, the veterans are now complaining that the game is too hard. Ha! Too easy now too hard? Pick a side and stick with it, I thought. I'm starting to agree with them though, the game has become harder than it was after the BB patch, but it's still easier than before. The major updates, like Chaos, Legends, and Jump were all very exciting, especially if you play with friends. This game is hugely based on friends. It is SO boring without friends to play with. The game actually rewards you for playing with your friends now, apparently. I used to have MS open 24 hours per day for 7 days a week, even though I wasn't there to play myself - I just wanted to have it open for when I got home. (That's kind of exaggerated; My longest time on MS was only 77 hours, after which I had dc'd).If you were to ask me what MS is about, I couldn't tell you. There is just so much to it, you have to experience it yourself. But let me warn you. The game doesn't like new players. It feeds on the old ones, like me, who have characters over level 150 (the max being 250). I really like it though. if I were to start all over, I'd only be willing to do it with friends (and if I had the time. I basically have no time for MS anymore because of school).Back to Steam MS though. This Steam version is weird. It sometimes works and it sometimes doesn't work. Many people experience trouble with the Steam version for a variety of issues: someone typed in the wrong email address, and so you can't change it; someone forgot their pin; the game doesn't load for some people; and the list goes on. My suggestion would to just play MS through the website if it doesn't work on Steam.Please disregard the amount of hours I have played MS on Steam. 80% hours are just from me afk'ing A LOT. The other 20% of those hours are me enjoying the game with my (now-dead) friends.Steam: JamilliaMS: ZeroJanaMain Class: ZeroLevel: 199World: BroaFavorite Channel: 17Longest friend: iForgettable (aka Joanne; she was just as old as me - in terms of how long she played - before she quit)Preferred Character: BishopAll of the classes I have ever created (in order to at least level 100):Bishop, I/L, Pirate, DB, BW, DW, Aran, Evan, NW, Bucc, Shadower, UA Sair, BaM, NL, CS, Merc, DS, TB, Jett, Phtm, UA DK, Mihile, Kaiser, Lumi, AnB, Hayato, Kanna,  Xenon, WA, BT, DA, Zero, EunwolHighest level character: 201 LuminousIf you have any questions about the game, go ahead and shoot me a question. I may not be able to help with every question, but I can try my best (I've been moderating the Steam MS forums since 2012).

content:
Posted: March 25
												So I know 15 minutes wtf man?Trust me when I say I have 100 of very enjoyable hours outside of the steam edition. So if I have over 100 hours and I enjoyed all those hours what is the issue.Simply the game has dropped in quallity faster then miley circus after dropping from Disney.Okay so lets go over Pros and Cons:Pros:- 2D Mmorpg (Very nice for those who like platformers)- A very nice feeling and still some community in late game.- First game I ever enjoyed grinding in.Cons: - Early game community is dead. Essentially a grind untill late game (Dramatically reducing the fun in low level grinding).- To many classes making even someone like me who essentially stopped playing 2012 and revisiting it now and again lost.- P4A (Pay for advantage) is accaptable but this game has a pay wall for late game.- But there is rebot! And tbh it seems decent but some factors are removed and once again we kinda fall on the lack of community thing.- One thing in rebot was no trade. Why? Because Nexon is not capable to stop hackers so inflation essentially took over maplestory for a while. And still have a huge impact on standard servers.Okay tbh the game is probably still decent but for any returning players just do not bother. This is no longer the game you love and is not even similar to it.

content:
Posted: December 17, 2015
												I started playing, tried the new reboot server that promised a better experience.  My auto-looting snail expired after five hours.  The game started expecting me to pick up items one by one at one third of the pace.  I stopped playing.If you expect me to play by spending five times more playtime looting than actually playing because you have to pay for 90 days of a modern expectations of a videogame then I just won't loot anything.  If I can't get anywhere without looting, then I just won't get anywhere.  If I can't get anywhere, there's no reason to play the game at all.People excuse it away with "oh but it's just five dollars for a pet".  The amount of money you have to pay for the feature is zero dollars.  It should come with the game.  Strongarming players into purchases is a rubbish business tactic that only results in cheaters and private servers like there are now and it's a known fact that Nexon themselves are throttling the rate at which players can loot items to try and sell pets.  There are plenty of other places I can take that "just five dollars" and more than likely they'll involve pressing more than just SHIFT and ALT for hours on end.

content:
Posted: December 17, 2015
												I started playing, tried the new reboot server that promised a better experience.  My auto-looting snail expired after five hours.  The game started expecting me to pick up items one by one at one third of the pace.  I stopped playing.If you expect me to play by spending five times more playtime looting than actually playing because you have to pay for 90 days of a modern expectations of a videogame then I just won't loot anything.  If I can't get anywhere without looting, then I just won't get anywhere.  If I can't get anywhere, there's no reason to play the game at all.People excuse it away with "oh but it's just five dollars for a pet".  The amount of money you have to pay for the feature is zero dollars.  It should come with the game.  Strongarming players into purchases is a rubbish business tactic that only results in cheaters and private servers like there are now and it's a known fact that Nexon themselves are throttling the rate at which players can loot items to try and sell pets.  There are plenty of other places I can take that "just five dollars" and more than likely they'll involve pressing more than just SHIFT and ALT for hours on end.

content:
Posted: November 6, 2015
												In Maplestory, you play as some anime hobbit roaming the world of Azeroth. It seems everyone worships mushroom people for some reason, a rip off of Mario. You can chose a class like the ones you would expect from some MMORPG, I chose mage. You have many powers, like shooting snail shells, I kid you not. The world is littered with fungi and giant snails, ripping off The Smurfs. Eventually you go to Antarctica, with many penguins staring deeply into your soul, ripping off Club Penguin. The problem with this game is that it tries to appeal to everybody, with anime, magic, pirates. Which happen to be ripping off Attack on titan, the Lord of the Rings, and Pirates of the Carribean. The whole game seems like some pitch for a Cartoon Network show, except that it throws you in a postapocalyptic world, with magic and monsters at every corner...Ripping off Adventure Time

content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												Heard about the new reboot server, decided to give maplestory a shot again, I can tell ya right now, I love this way more than classic maplestory, you get thrown right into the action(you can skip the first 10 levels of your class aka the tutorial levels) This game does a good job of making you feel like a badass, and that feeling only gets solidified the more you play.The reboot server allows you to play in an environment where you can purchase the main cash shop items that make the game "p2w" with mesos instead of rl$, in addition mesos drop rate is 5x, experience is higher, but mobs are harder, and there's no trading, in a way it's like diablo 3's 2.0 update but for maplestory, if you're getting back into maplestory I definitely recommend the reboot server to ease your way back in, it kinda almost feels like a private server within the game but well balanced... that said, if I was in the main server I would've had around 8b mesos on my first day in due to the event items I squandered, the drop rates have gotten a lot better and I definitely recommend this game if you're looking for an mmoarpg platformer.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 25, 2014
												I started playing Maplestory years ago. There were three classes, with a fourth not entirely finished yet. Speed ahead, the number is probably 30 or more, and what has the game got to show for it? About 5GB's, apparently. Maplestory is a seemingly simple game when it comes to design, however, this is an understatement in magnitudes. The amount of detail put into the tiniest of things is fairly impressive, and the overall composition is balanced, visually at the least. To quantify it, I'd give it a 9 of 10, as it has a very certain style that it has kept to for many years, improving it with each update. The game, the game, you are probably criping about. The game is... Well, bland, if you let it be. The original Maplestory would take upward of hundreds of hours to gain only a few number of levels, often resulting in the player gaining access to OTHER ways of burning hundreds and hundreds of hours. My first account was around level 70 before it was lost to the stupidity of youth. It took some two years of leisure play, that as I now look back at, was sickening. The Maplestory today has enacted a story-line for the player to follow, one that of course, is entirely optional, but is largely beneficial to the player seeking to access everything in a timely manner. From the start to 70 again, it took roughly 12-24 hours in total play time. Some quests would level the player massively, and this made for a huge jump in playability. Yet... in doing this it crippled the need to explore a lot of the lower-level maps. You find yourself swamping back and forth in the same few areas that match your level range, seeing the same monsters over and over until the quest and level set is complete.Why play this, you ask?When you can get a set of people to join you, it's a genuinely remember-able experience. Bosses in this game are NOT easy to take alone, and you'll often need to coordinate in a huge number of ways. Thankfully, each class HAS A PLACE. The game has a balance between each class that makes it so when the individual is party-searching, they aren't met with any EXTREME class bias. Aside from the healer being chosen first. But say you are alone, what then is there to amuse you? WELL! Discovering all this constantly expanding world has to offer. The quests are endless, and if you don't fancy doing them, just kill things! Each monster (after a certain level) has a different set of attacks that you'll need to account for. You'll be hard-pressed to find a situation where you can just spam one attack infinitely (not to say there aren't opportunities). On this, each class has a moderate-to-diverse range of available moves that will require a balance to use in a successful manner. Hotkeys a plenty, the user will likely stick between 5-6 moves they prefer, and use them as the situation calls need. This game can be played ANY TIME, there is rarely a situation where you are FORCED to stay on or else feel some emotional, internal struggle, when you leave it behind. It's simple to pick up... sorta?In recent years, the game has been working on adding and building on the game... without much improving what is there? They've added personality traits that influence your ability, POTENTIAL for weapons that influence them in some way or another, and yet, it looks clunky and visually, confusing. When I joined, it was a simple set of 5-6 buttons and the buttons to operate these menus as appropriate. Now, you'll be bombarded with tabs on tabs of flashing icons that all HOPE to enhance your playing experience. Usually... it just leaves you confused. The game has made strides in playability, enjoyableness, and the content that is available to all without the need to throw money at the screen. Yet, it still has a while to go. To again, quantify it, I'd give it an 8 of 10, as what it has added has enriched the content, by being oblivious to mechanical things that desperately need improvement. I'd say, play the game, give it a few hours, and you'll probably end up playing it once or twice a week out of the sheer quantity within it you'll have to discover.

												This game was a staple part of my childhood, and I could never dislike it, but be warned, the game is pay-to-win, but not as much as people like to make it seem. The Reboot server eliminates everything that made Maplestory P2W, so there's no reason not to try it.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 6, 2012
												MapleStory is a Korean 2D MMORPG with platform elements. Its unique style made me try it back in 2006, thus it became my first MMO game. Rich 2D graphics, relaxing music, anime-style cuteness in every detail. It came a long way from being a hacker-infested grind-fest to what it is today, a rather fun game with a lot of things to do in a huge world. There is still quite a lot of grinding involved, but the EXP curve is much more relaxed now with bosses taking less time to kill, which leaves players a chance to try out different characters. Level cap is set to 250, so level-chasing never stops. The hardest part of this game is becoming rich without investing real money into it, so don't expect getting yourself top equips easily.All in all, MapleStory is not without flaws, but despite its publisher's attempts to turn it into a pay-2-win kind of game it still managed to keep its charm thanks to its adorable design and unique platform-like mechanics.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												Heard about the new reboot server, decided to give maplestory a shot again, I can tell ya right now, I love this way more than classic maplestory, you get thrown right into the action(you can skip the first 10 levels of your class aka the tutorial levels) This game does a good job of making you feel like a badass, and that feeling only gets solidified the more you play.The reboot server allows you to play in an environment where you can purchase the main cash shop items that make the game "p2w" with mesos instead of rl$, in addition mesos drop rate is 5x, experience is higher, but mobs are harder, and there's no trading, in a way it's like diablo 3's 2.0 update but for maplestory, if you're getting back into maplestory I definitely recommend the reboot server to ease your way back in, it kinda almost feels like a private server within the game but well balanced... that said, if I was in the main server I would've had around 8b mesos on my first day in due to the event items I squandered, the drop rates have gotten a lot better and I definitely recommend this game if you're looking for an mmoarpg platformer.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 6, 2012
												MapleStory is a Korean 2D MMORPG with platform elements. Its unique style made me try it back in 2006, thus it became my first MMO game. Rich 2D graphics, relaxing music, anime-style cuteness in every detail. It came a long way from being a hacker-infested grind-fest to what it is today, a rather fun game with a lot of things to do in a huge world. There is still quite a lot of grinding involved, but the EXP curve is much more relaxed now with bosses taking less time to kill, which leaves players a chance to try out different characters. Level cap is set to 250, so level-chasing never stops. The hardest part of this game is becoming rich without investing real money into it, so don't expect getting yourself top equips easily.All in all, MapleStory is not without flaws, but despite its publisher's attempts to turn it into a pay-2-win kind of game it still managed to keep its charm thanks to its adorable design and unique platform-like mechanics.

content:
Posted: October 7, 2015
												I wish the game would come back. One of the best parts of the game, if not the best, isthe community this game has generated. I love the people that play this game and they make me laugh every day. It's almost impossible to become very strong without spending thousands of dollars on the game, but you don't need to be strong to have fun. There is so much story line to go through and so many people to do it with. Create a character at the same time with a friend and help each other with the quest line. It is so much more fun this way. The level cap is 250 and it is, and I quote, extremely difficult to reach it. If you do reach the level cap in the game you are god tier. This doesn't mean you are strong still but everybody will know who you are. Have fun with this game and explore every class. I have reached a very high level, still not 250 but Ihave been playing for years and I will love this game until the end. I would do almost anything to have a larger community so please do download the game and check out the giant world, thousands of quests and difficult bosses that this game, very close to my heart, has to offer. I have logged hundreds of hours and look forward to each and every update. Good luck and have fun, I hope the in-game economy treats you well. :)

content:
Posted: February 27
												So I played Maplestory years ago and thought I'd revisit it after spotting it here on steam. After a 10gb download (it was under 3gb last time I played!) I attempted to login with my old details, seems my password no longer works. No problem, I'll just make a new one. No, there's an error, "this service is not available". Ok, so I'll contact Nexon technical support, they'll help me. No, it seems they won't, not without providing them with the registered e-mail address for the account (It's the one I'm using to contact you, duh!), my purchase history for the last 90 days (ermm, I can't purchase anything if I can't login to the account!) and also photo ID to prove I am who I say I am. Given that they don't already have that information it will verify nothing.So to sum up: worst tech support ever, they don't want you to play their game, don't waste your time.

content:
Posted: April 27, 2014
												I've got alot of history with this game. Even for the last six years playing the game. The game has a lot of classes, but the primary classes are warrior, magician, thief, bowman(archer), and pirate. The warrior is your standard damage dealer with high defenses. The mage has powerful magic attacks but bad defenses unless you have a buff that reduce damage. The theif does major damage up close(dagger) or from afar(claw) while using stealth. The bowman uses either a bow or a crossbow dealing critical damage. The pirate is like the theif minus the stealth and replacing daggers with knuckles and claws with guns. PVP used to be level 30 to enter but and update made it level 70. In the game the world or mapleworld and yes that is its world is called was ruled by a dark wizard or otherwise the black mage until five(six) sealed him away but the cost was that they were fronzen for hundreds of years. In its latest update "Grand Atheneaum" shows how the black mage came to be. Some of the community can imature but I usually ignore it. If you don't like the community the content is what might get you hooked on this game. There are some events where some classes will be availible; like the ZERO class where you start from level 100 until you hit 180 so you escape mirror world where s/he is seal. seriously zero's story can be REAL funny. At level 30, then to, 60 and finaly 100 and the rumored 5th job advancement. The community accuses other 2D RPG's of being a ripoff(bull). After playng for over 6 years I Proudly give this game 9.75/10

content:
Posted: February 10, 2014
												People always make fun of this game because it is a grind and that it is repetitive and this than and the other, and while that can't be disputed, that is just what MMOs are.People like me who love to watch and calculate progress in a character over a period of time love to play games like this because it is so easy to look at your stats and see where you've gone and how much you have progressed sense you were just a level 1 newbie.I will admit, this game isn't for everyone, but it has this charming appeal to it. The cute characters, flashy skills, the plethora of classes you have to play at almost any given chance. You'll find something to do, you'll find some monsters to kill, you'll have some quests to do, all you have to do is be comitted to the game.While I wouldn't reccomend this to everyone, if you are looking for a different turn on the MMORPG, this is your game.I give it an 8/10.P.S: Play  on Scania.

content:
Posted: April 11, 2014
												I love love love love MapleStory. It's a fun MMO that is easy to get into and provides a steady and satisfying climb. I feel like I've made if further in about a month of this game than I have in any other MMO, but that doesn't mean it's easy. Combining MMORPG elements with minor 2d platforming works well, and there's a reason MapleStory is still one of the world's most popular MMOs even after being around for over a decade. Still, if you dislike microtransactions, be warned: This is one of the greediest games of it's kind I've played. Most cash items only last for 90 days, but cost the same as permenant cosmetics in other games. Still, even without spending a dime, it's the kind of game that should provide enjoyment for the MMO or RPG enthusiast.

content:
Posted: August 10, 2012
												I'm surprised it took so many bloody years for Steam to actually have this, maybe Nexon is losing some people, I dunno. It's happened with Combat Arms... anyway,Cute, cruel and creative Maplestory is one of the only games I've known to date in the Western market to be well loved by most as perhaps the only online MMORPG that is the purveyour of the faces known today such as o3o, 0///0 and =_=;.There are 18 classes split into 4 'job's fitting a specialisation with branching choices.Each with a very unique set of enjoyable and fun skills to play with it. It is FUN, usually...However, a caveat for newer players. This game involves A LOT of grinding, and I mean a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of grinding to be done. If you are a ranged class like I was, you can run out of ammo. Early game playing can very tedious and boring. However, the tradeoff is the middle to end game, at this point many classes will have most of their skills and specialised - and it feel incredibly powerful when you see your dmg.

content:
Posted: August 10, 2012
												Who hasn't played Maplestory at least ONCE in their lives? Maplestory is a game 2d sidescrolling MMO, nothing really fancy about that since it provide everything an MMO should.  This game was pretty much meant to be directed for the younger gamers that would want something to waste their time with alone or with friends.  Maplestory is a really asthetic game, it has lots of different unique sceneries to it and the art work is just amazing to look at, very colorful and unique.  The gameplay plays like a hack & slash combat style that include a wide variety of skills and weapons to use.  though it is as well an RPG, so expect some grinding, a LOT of grinding which would what make this game become repetative at times.  Maplestory also has a big focus on social interaction, such as being able to become "families", having plazas primarily for social interaction, to even get married to other players!  I would say to give this game a go at least once if you haven't. Recommended!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1, 2014
												Hands down, best MMORPG I have EVER played! I have been playing on and off for 4 years now and I'm not even level 200 and the level cap has INCREASED! Maplestory is a game for all ages and ranges from the ghettos of Kerning city to the carnival of Malaysia, cold snow of El Nath, suffocating feeling of Aqua Road and the ever so magical feeling of being in the Temple of Time.Not only are the maps extensive but as are the classes. For 4 years I have been playing as a Thief, but now a Night Lord, and I have never been disappointed. Content is updated and classes are always being revamped. You might not be able to change classes like in Mabinogi, but you will not be disappointed if you choose the right class the first time.The monsters can be either really creepy or really cute. As in creepy I mean maybe some weird looking creatures but none will really leave you with nightmares except maybe Thantos or Pink Bean if you die a lot against it. Most of the monsters can be very adorable or just very well drawn. Many maps allow for good sniping which is vital for a class like mine or pirates with guns, etc. There's no end to the monsters because they just keep coming when there's new events and new places to visit. I could go on and on all day about how AMAZING Maplestory truly is. It keeps you playing and has great art and a wholesome storyline that is bent and twisted depending on your character. Don't pass this game up, especially cause it's "Free to play".

content:
Posted: May 23, 2014
												Maplestory is a game I have been playing for quite a while (I think 7-8 years) and I still love it! Many people's complaints are that the game is "too easy" or "easier" than how it was previously, and it's true, it is easier, but the big problem I see with their complaint, is that the game will still take hours of your time to max a character. It was only recently that level 250s appeared, and that took them months to go from 200-250. I realize this game is a lot of grinding, but the same can be said for a lot of other MMORPGs on the internet. The music in this game is amazing and deserves a listen to, especially in places like Henesys. The gameplay, while being very grind heavy, is fun and fast paced! You've got a wide variety of characters each with their own set of skills (5 different sets: 1st Job, 2nd Job, 3rd Job, 4th Job, and Hyper Skills with the exception of Evan, Dual Blader, and any others that have more than 4 Job Advancements), and while some are overpowered, this game isn't a competition unless you make it a competition! Another complaint people have is that there are several "Pay-to-Win" concepts in the Cash Shop such as EXP boosts, Money Bags, and ways to make your equipment better, but once again, it's NOT a competition. There may be some PvP side areas, but if you don't want to go against somebody with overpowered equipment, just don't go to the Battle Square! All the things people complain about are easily fixed on our ends! If it annoys you that people decide to be all high and mighty about their high level characters, ignore them! It doesn't matter! This game isn't a competition, it's simply a game for messing about on your own or with friends. People argue that people rarely do Party Quests anymore, which is true, I can't argue against that, but Party Quests are not required by any means, they are just a fun way of getting EXP. My biggest complaint with the way Maplestory is, however, the fact that a higher level cannot train a lower level like we used to. If there is too big of a difference between your level and the person you are training/being trained by, or maybe between the lower level and monster's level (20-30 levels I believe) then you will not get ANY EXP from their kills, meaning if you want to play with your friend's higher level character, there won't be much point because they'll be the ones getting experience. My main point is that almost everything people complain about is how much more powerful certain classes are, or how powerful people can make equipment by paying, or how much money people can get by paying, but the fact of the matter is, this game is only a competition for those that want to make it a competition. This game isn't meant for you to challenge a random stranger to a hunt, but rather to challenge your friends to a hunt. Overall, Maplestory is a great game as long as you remember that it's not a competition, and if you're the type who can't stand people being better than you at a game, or can't stand it not being a competition, than I can't help you.

For 4 years I have been playing as a Thief, but now a Night Lord, and I have never been disappointed. Content is updated and classes are always being revamped. You might not be able to change classes like in Mabinogi, but you will not be disappointed if you choose the right class the first time.The monsters can be either really creepy or really cute. As in creepy I mean maybe some weird looking creatures but none will really leave you with nightmares except maybe Thantos or Pink Bean if you die a lot against it. Most of the monsters can be very adorable or just very well drawn. Many maps allow for good sniping which is vital for a class like mine or pirates with guns, etc. There's no end to the monsters because they just keep coming when there's new events and new places to visit. I could go on and on all day about how AMAZING Maplestory truly is. It keeps you playing and has great art and a wholesome storyline that is bent and twisted depending on your character. Don't pass this game up, especially cause it's "Free to play".

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 31, 2014
												For being a free to play MMORPG game, Maplestory is phenomenol having amazing classic MMORPG elements in it such as a crap-ton of quests, bosses, dungeons and 32 DIFFERENT classes at the moment with more on the way! Its artstlye is extemely charming as well. Maplestory is hands down the best free MMORPG game I have ever played, and is a lot better then some paid ones.Now to one of my angry rants about other reviews I've seen about this game....I have seen many downvotes saying that it is a pay to play game or a pay to win game and some even saying its IMPOSSIBLE to play without paying actual money. it is DEFINITELY NOT a pay to play/win game. 80% of items bought with actual money (NX cash in game) are purely cosmetic either giving you funky hair cuts, pets, different eyes, faces, mounts, changing the look of your weapon, emotes and other things like that. the other 20% of items bought with money are little helper items, like auto pickup items, auto heal items, 2x drop rate, 2x EXP etc etc. Yes those little items help, but I havent spent a dime on this game and i've gotten permanent mounts and pets, 2hour 2x coupons, 1h 2x drop rate couons just from playing the game and participating in events and the events arent a hassel, they are fun and accessable from anywhere in the world!Is Maplestory a pay to play/win game? NO!Is it awesome? YES!Looking for a good MMORPG to get into? GET IT!

content:
Posted: December 19, 2013
												i have played this game since it left beta, and i must say it was better then. like typical MMO's, it originally had you tanks, DPS (ranged and cqc), mage, and healer. really simple and user friendly battle systems when in a party. not anymore. after many years the game has tried to appeal to a younger generation of players by adding in new classes and jobs, thus rendering all the old (and in my opinion, better) classes weak and underpowered unless you spend real money to buy enhancements for weapons and equips. naturally since its a free to play MMO, its going to be pay to win, there is no getting around that.the artwork is amazing, and same applies to the bgm, top notch job to the developers on that. gameplay is very hard to describe as i find my self hitting a plateau so to speak every handful of levels, at some higher levels, (140+) monsters are either too weak to effectively grind on, or are just too strong for most classes (i playan assassin, known for low hp) unless you for out the cash and most quests have minimal rewards. this game is solid, and has been from day one, give it a shot, try it out, if you get into it then i would reccomend getting some nx(in game currency bought with rl money) and make your self op as hell. BIGGEST TIP, research classes and jobs before you creat a new character,

												This game had an unbeatable community experience years ago despite the bigger number whoring.Pink lenses aside, you really have to question if "This is my job" and "I'm just feeding my family" are appropriate justification for spreading a culture and expectation of greed trumping all forms of morality.Ironically, if this kind of industry is meant as a way of siphoning money out of the NA market and fix global disparity even a little bit, all you've done is reinforce the values that you may have been trying to stop. If it wasn't, the sheer excess of number-grubbing is sure to cause "materialism catharsis" in more than a few people.In short, "this game is ok."

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 19, 2015
												I would put this game somewhere between an mmo and a proper grind-fest like diablo. Like an mmo, It's all about leveling, questing, bossing, and socializing. The game also starts really slow and boring because you don't have any of the flashy attacks this game is known for. once you get your cool attacks at lvl 60 and 100, you feel like such a bad♥♥♥♥♥ seriously, you could be the worst player but still feel awesome.  The diablo aspect comes in when you start gearing. Some time since I played this game 6 years ago and now, Nexon added a really simple way to upgrade your gear. I won't go into /too/ much detail here but the jist of it is you can make all your gear really powerful for cheap. when I hit level 100 (normally about 8 hours into the game), I got a set of gear that I upgraded and is still viable at my curent level (150). all of my items have an affix like (+7, 8 stars) and they glow in fancy colors adding to the badass "feel" of the game.   as long as you don't compair your self to other player who have been playing longer, you'll feel like a maplestory god only 12 hours into the game.Over all, I reccomend this game but understand that a lot of people aren't into the whole grinding and upgrading gear thing. The game is great for people who are but can be almost impossible to have fun with for people who aren't.

content:
Posted: February 27
												So I played Maplestory years ago and thought I'd revisit it after spotting it here on steam. After a 10gb download (it was under 3gb last time I played!) I attempted to login with my old details, seems my password no longer works. No problem, I'll just make a new one. No, there's an error, "this service is not available". Ok, so I'll contact Nexon technical support, they'll help me. No, it seems they won't, not without providing them with the registered e-mail address for the account (It's the one I'm using to contact you, duh!), my purchase history for the last 90 days (ermm, I can't purchase anything if I can't login to the account!) and also photo ID to prove I am who I say I am. Given that they don't already have that information it will verify nothing.So to sum up: worst tech support ever, they don't want you to play their game, don't waste your time.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 19, 2013
												i have played this game since it left beta, and i must say it was better then. like typical MMO's, it originally had you tanks, DPS (ranged and cqc), mage, and healer. really simple and user friendly battle systems when in a party. not anymore. after many years the game has tried to appeal to a younger generation of players by adding in new classes and jobs, thus rendering all the old (and in my opinion, better) classes weak and underpowered unless you spend real money to buy enhancements for weapons and equips. naturally since its a free to play MMO, its going to be pay to win, there is no getting around that.the artwork is amazing, and same applies to the bgm, top notch job to the developers on that. gameplay is very hard to describe as i find my self hitting a plateau so to speak every handful of levels, at some higher levels, (140+) monsters are either too weak to effectively grind on, or are just too strong for most classes (i playan assassin, known for low hp) unless you for out the cash and most quests have minimal rewards. this game is solid, and has been from day one, give it a shot, try it out, if you get into it then i would reccomend getting some nx(in game currency bought with rl money) and make your self op as hell. BIGGEST TIP, research classes and jobs before you creat a new character,

content:
Posted: December 20, 2015
												Maplestory is that game you played in 2005 with your friend, then quit because the grind was real. You come back 2-3 years later, things are really cool, updated. Then you quit again. You're bored one day and reminisce about the good ol' grind with your friends staying up for days just for that one level, so you get the game again, now you're flabergasted. Mechanics have changed, there are so many classes, things look so fun now. Best part, you can be a psychic. 10/10 would quit, play, and do it all over again. Good times.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 19, 2015
												I would put this game somewhere between an mmo and a proper grind-fest like diablo. Like an mmo, It's all about leveling, questing, bossing, and socializing. The game also starts really slow and boring because you don't have any of the flashy attacks this game is known for. once you get your cool attacks at lvl 60 and 100, you feel like such a bad♥♥♥♥♥ seriously, you could be the worst player but still feel awesome.  The diablo aspect comes in when you start gearing. Some time since I played this game 6 years ago and now, Nexon added a really simple way to upgrade your gear. I won't go into /too/ much detail here but the jist of it is you can make all your gear really powerful for cheap. when I hit level 100 (normally about 8 hours into the game), I got a set of gear that I upgraded and is still viable at my curent level (150). all of my items have an affix like (+7, 8 stars) and they glow in fancy colors adding to the badass "feel" of the game.   as long as you don't compair your self to other player who have been playing longer, you'll feel like a maplestory god only 12 hours into the game.Over all, I reccomend this game but understand that a lot of people aren't into the whole grinding and upgrading gear thing. The game is great for people who are but can be almost impossible to have fun with for people who aren't.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 16, 2015
												Where to start.... the game is definitely not easy to learn to say the least. Most of that comes from the fact that it is very old so it doesnt conform to the normal key layouts or UI schemes, not to mention that its maximum resolution is 1366x768. It is very difficult to figure out where to go for quests and even when you get there it is difficult to figure out who to talk to. There are too many classes. And all of those classes have job advancements which are basically just linear sub classes. Leveling is just grinding monsters or doing quests which are much slower compared to monsters. The level cap for most classes is very high and you gain nothing from leveling except the chance to fight higher leveled monsters. As far as I've seen there is no health regeneration and very little mana regeneration which causes people to rely heavily on potions for sustain. This and the fact that higher skill advancements cost a lot of money means that towards end game, "funding" becomes very important. MS is definitely for the mostpart a P2W game. A game like this would surely have been popular ten years ago but by today's standards it is woefully antiquated.

												88.9 hours on steam but before i installed it on steam i had it on my old pc and have well over 2000 hours. i have several level 100 and up characters and have been playing the game for years. It is extremely fun but can feel very static at times due to the quests. Most quests are kill X amount of these enemies and pick up X amount of items from them. It is very fun in the begining but when u hit level 130 or higher it is very very very very VERY slow. I would recommend this game and say play it because it is fun but once you hit like 115 just start over unless you really really want to get the hyper skill at level 170 but you will be playing for months to get from 130 to 170.

Even a warrior has a flash step, the ♥♥♥♥?- Quests are a mess unless you have a hyper teleport rock (Paid item) which teleport you where you need to go.- Winter events are a mess, 'DO THIS, DO THAT, GET YOUR REWARD' waitwut? Thanks for telling me where said reward is. If there servers weren't lagging or constsantly disconnecting me, I'd be atleast content playing, but it's not fun when it takes 10 seconds to pick up a single item on the floor, or you hit a mob of enemies then have to wait a few seconds for them to die. You're forced to purchase a pet to pick up everything on the floor efficiently, if that's not good enough you need to buy several items for the pet to pick up items/mesos/etc items. Yeah, I ♥♥♥♥♥ and whine but I'll still end up playing this game, it's too deeply embedded into  my soul.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 8, 2016
												I started playing Maplestory in June of 2005, just weeks after its was released to the North American region. Man, the memories I had wasting my time on this game. Even though I stopped around early 2007, I will never forget those two years where I wasted my life playing the game. The summers of 2005 and 2006 where I played non-stop with friends, those cold-winter days where I did quest runs with randoms, and those Saturday nights playing the game while watching the Boondocks on Adult Swim. Even though I had a lot of fond memories of Maplestory, it was not that good of a game. With the arrival of the NX-Shop in late 05/early 06, the game's model turned from Free MMO to Free to Pay. It might have been the first instance I have experienced F2P. At first, the Nexon Shop offered cosmetic upgrades and various useless as fuck trinkets; it was fine at first. Slowly but surely, the OP game-breaking weapons started pouring in. By the start of 2007, Maplestory was littered with alternate accounts/players boosting from low levels to ridiculously high levels in the matter of a few hours; all they had to do was shell out a couple of dollars. It was at this point, the Maplestory community turned toxic. If all the xXAzNnAbuGo1995Xx names didn't ruin it for you, the dick measuring contests and the constant fleecing might have.Naturally, I took a break from the game for a good year and a half. I came back in the summer of 2008, and what do you know? Still the same bullshit as last time. From that point, I completely gave up on Maplestory, uninstalled it from my computer, and tried blocking anything MS related from my head. Fast-forward to 2016. I was browsing the Free-Game section on Steam, saw it, and thought to myself "why not? Let's see if it changed a single bit." So I downloaded it, had to restore my Nexon account, and renew the credentials in order to play it. Got it up and running, and played it for a bit. Here are my thoughts.THE GOOD:+ My account somehow survived 8 years of inactivity. Though my character names got fucked in the process. (see THE BAD for more details)+ My friend's list remained intact, even though most of my friends had their names messed up too.+ All of my items, equips, weapons, and quests - including completed, finished, and in progress - were retained too!+ It's really easy to level up. Some long-time players think this is a bad thing, but not me. It used to take so long to level up back in the early days. To give you some perspective: it would take 2 hours to get from level 41 to level 42 (no matter your character's profession) in 2005/2006, now it takes 4 hours to get from level 40 to level 50. + Dat music doe. It hits me right in the nostalgia, and it's pretty rockin too.THE BAD:- Character names on inactive accounts were changed into a long-string of numbers. If you had not logged in since 2013, your characters will have fucked numbers for names because Nexon purged some useless data from their servers.- There's only 3 screen resolutions in the game: 800 x 600, 1024 x 768, and 1368 x 768. Trying to modify the screen resolution will result in a ban from Nexon, so don't even think about it. It's 2016, and Nexon can't even be pressed to provide support for 1920 x 1080. What the fuck.- The game still runs in 16bit color mode. I understand the sprites were created as early as 2001 or even 2000, but it's just inexcusable to see those color dots all over the screen. - Main function keys are still not rebindable. I'm sorry Wizet/Nexon, I do not like moving my character with my right hand. Can you at least allow us to rebind it to WASD?- The world map is still a bitch to navigate. - Game still has spotty netcode. Those iconic hiccups were you might teleport from one side of the map to the other is still here.- NX Shop has an even stronger presence than before.- The community is effectively dead; no one is playing anymore. It's really weird to see the Scania server have open slots in their 20 channels. THE MIXED:~ Controller support. There is finally support for game pads, and unfortunately it's very spotty (my PS3 controller's d-pad was not recognizable). However, your standard console pads do not have enough buttons to accomodate various functions, especially when you get into the higher levels and need a lot of hotkeys.~ Cut-scenes. I don't think there were cut-scenes in MS when I started playing, so it's a nice addition. However, most of these cut-scenes are unskippable and a pain in the ass to watch.Overall, I cannot recommend this game for newcomers, but I do recommend it for old-timers who want to get back in and play it for old-time's sake. However, the game is on its deathbed. Nexon is contemplating on retiring the service by the end of this decade. Before that happens, Maplestory 2 will have more than likely be localized to the states. For those who are wondering, yes there is a Maplestory 2, and yes it is garbage. It has Maplestory aesthetics, combined with isometric ARPG gameplay with Minecraft's voxel influence mixed in.rating as of this moment: 5/10.

content:
Posted: February 26, 2016
												With all the changes throughout the years and the recent addition of the Reboot server there's never been a better time to join MapleStory if you haven't tried it out already! At current count, there are somewhere around 40+ playable job classes in the game although they aren't always open for creation all the time. The level cap has also been increased to 250 for all job classes as of the most recent updates (although I believe this was actually from a while ago).In case you are wondering, the Reboot server levels the playing field between paying and f2p players of the game by eliminating a  lot of the items from the in-game cash shop. Now everyone has the same opportunity to gather items and increase the damage of their characters in the same ways--by working for them of course! Lots of items that were limited to only the cash shop are now in an npc shop for players to purchase via the in-game currency (mesos). There are still some convenience/travel and appearance items in the Reboot cash shop for those players interested in purchasing them.I hope to see you in-game and Happy Mapling! :-)[ Please note: my Steam time on this game isn't an adequate reflection of my actual play-time of this game, I've been playing since the introduction of the Cannoneer job class ~2011]

content:
Posted: September 18, 2014
												I have been playing this game off and on since the game finished beta. I love it because the stories are deep and make you feel for your character. I cried during my Mercedes story when I first started, and I have cried many times since then. I have also smiled when my character achieves something, or saves someone. This alone makes me want to return. I do wish the game would add a bit more into it as fighting all the time can get boring. I long for exploring and finding things. This is one reason I keep taking breaks, not enough things to do for me. But I am a gamer who loves the exploration above all else. Fighting can wait. Also there are so many classes now that it is kind of overwhelming. Then again, with so many classes it is very easy to find where you fit in. Also, the game has seen many years and is still a popular game to play. Considering all of this, I give this game a 7 out of 10.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2014
												I've been play MapleStory for many years so I have bias towards it but regardless I'll try to be honest about it.MapleStory is unlike many MMOs by the fact that it is a 2D sidescroller. Apart from maybe GunBound, therearen't many 2DMMORPGs around and Nexon has done an incredible job over the years developing this game.Although it's quite different now from when I first played it, I still find myself being drawn back in by the seasonalevents they put on annually. I've never truly stopped playing MapleStory for this reason. I can go months and evenyears without play it but still find myself logging in to see what's been changed and updated.CLASSES!so MapleStory has an insane amount of classes. Although there are the 6 base classes (or jobs as they call it) of Thief, Magician, Warrrior, Archer, Pirate and Beginner (yes, some people play the game as the starting character and don't choose a job). There are seperate job groups that change the standard formula. This means there are a totalof 28 unique classes (not including the different Beginner or starter classes). And they are constantly balancing andadding more each year.F2PThe game is free to play with mirco transactions, however it's not pay to win. You can buy EXP boosts but only up to a certain level meaning high level characters have attained it without forking out money to boost there. There is plethoraof cosmetic item and more are constantly added.DownsidesNow like most MMORPGs you will eventually find yourself stuck doing fetchquests and grinding for hours. It's for this reason I often stop playing during the main chunk of the year. My advice is to play during holidays such as Christmas, Easter, Halloween, Thanksgiving and New Years. That's where the most fun is.

content:
Posted: July 12, 2014
												I'm normally not into MMOs, but this game is quite a gem! Rather than list the fun parts of the game, since there are so many, I'll just list the few issues:- Veterans, or people who are later in the game are usually ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. Sometimes they throw large wads of cash on the streets to watch the pesant noobs fight to the death over it (basically the definition of a rich scumbag), and sometimes they spawn high level enemies in early parts of the game.- Paid items are extremely restricted. When you pay for an in game item, you should expect to be able to keep it. As it turns out, you usually can't in this game. The limitations are often for months or something, but there shouldn't be a time limit at all! Buying anything, even the teleportation rocks, is basically a scam.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 30, 2014
												Maple isn't too bad of a MMO, if you can deal with fetch quests requiring 20+ of two or more items, massive level grinding after lvl 60, and the occasional hacker here or there. The game has multiple classes for players to chose from, each with their own unique play styles, and each one, having played the majority of classes myself, having various pros and cons to playing. The over-arching story, while barely touched upon in-game until MUCH higher levels, is fairly interesting and compelling, and with a large amount of quests to choose from, you'll almost never find yourself with nothing to do. The style is fairly childish, and the events may get a bit gimmicky now and then, but all-in-all Maplestory is a pretty okay game to play, especially if you're just starting out in the MMO genre.

content:
Posted: July 17, 2014
												With over 100 million accounts created, Maplestory is probably the most played free-to-play MMORPG of all time.  Maplestory is a 2D side-scrolling, fantasy MMORPG with a massive amount of features and things to do.  Although the game is now over nine years old, the game continues on strong with regular updates and patches, and has significantly upgraded the game engine and graphics since its early days. If you can handle MapleStory’s child-like, cartoony graphics, this game has a ton to offer. MapleStory now has 30 classes and counting as of 2014

content:
Posted: August 21, 2014
												I'm 27 years old. This is the only game other than WoW that has really held my attention since I started playing both in 2006. Yeah its got a wonky soul sucking cash shop. Yeah they add new classes and throw shiny♥♥♥♥♥♥in your face to get you playing again. One thing they are good at though, is IMPROVING! They mimicked Cataclysm and had a "Big Bang" update a few years back that DRASTICALLY reduced the xp needed to level(it was a crazy grind), streamlined the world, made things alot more convenient. I truly believe they love their fans, as much as they grab for cash. The anime shorts in the game and the story of each class gets better and better. The only thing that tends to suck is the localization/translation. The more recent classes such as Kaiser/Angelic Buster/Cygnus Revamp, have just been utterly fantastic. I for one love the artsy charm of the Cygnus Knights.It may not be a game that transcends the boundaries of an MMO, but its been in business for years for a reason. Intelligentmarketing, well timed releases and promotions and TRULY awesome 2D Smash em/RPG flavor. I log probably 20-30 hours every 2-6 months or so and I usually end up dropping $10-20 along with it just to see whats new and I consider it money and time well spent. Not my every day game, but man don't we all have that one thing like Coke or Apple Pie we just CRAVE every now and then? We have a tall glass, then we move on with life. Try it, it just might end up being your gaming "comfort food" :)

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2015
												Hello everyone, my name is GoldenGuru, or GLDGuru, and today i'll be doing a review on Maplestory.This game holds a place in my heart, as this game was the first ever RPG game i have ever played.Ok, first we start off, make a account, create your char, yada yada. But, there are different kinds of classes, and if you are confused, here is what each class is/a very simple description of each class. (40 total)But since it would take me hours on hours describing each skill, you can check em out yourself on the maplestory wiki/website, link provided here: http://maplestory.nexon.net/game/classes-jobsAfter you get that, you are introduced to each group introduction. (Resistance for example, you are brought in after you reach level ten (does not apply for other resistance-type classes)After that, you go ahead and start you adventure by grinding mobs..? Grinding isnt as painful as some games, but when you use a class (Dual Blade) and get higher up, you're gonna be spending loads of money since EXP gain is hard. Bossing gets more of a issue also, since you might not do enough damage to take the boss down in time.Ok, i'll be honest, my highest level is 107, and I still dont have a Hyper Skill."What's a hyper skill?" - any newbieA hyper skill is basicly your fifth job advancement. Thats all I can say for now.What I do like mostly about maplestory is how much people are serious for grinding. Nobody will take in a Pirate sadly,  since people think that pirates are terrible for bossing, but I think they are good. (wink wink Mihile is bad wink wink)Another thing that I like about the game is the Classes, since they all are different, and as I said eairlier, !!40!! classes/jobs!. Same with bosses, with a ton of them (check them out yourself).The ONLY thing I dislike about maplestory is that you have to spend money alot, depending what class you are playing. Most classes will require funding because of the grinding once you get to 140+.Overall, I'd say maplestory is a 9/10, -1 because of funding and painful grinding, but +9 since I love the game.(This is my first guide, so please dont bash on me too much! :>)

content:
Posted: March 15, 2015
												I've played this for a few years, back and forth and have plenty notes on this.This game is if you don't know a side scrolling, immersive RPG. Character creation and such, like a 32 bit side scrolling Skyrim for lack of a better description. And it does it well. Very well! The combat is smooth and it never feels unfair. Gold is plentiful and nothing is too expensive in the in-game market. Classes are fun and characters have quite wonderful story personalities. Though there is the bad. My friend had great trouble mapping buttons to a controller. And the servers always seem to be busy, even with the sub servers leading up to thirty a piece.I can give it an 8/10. 9/10 if the servers were not so full so bloody often.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2015
												TL;DR: If you're a serious MMO gamer who wants to get more than 6 months worth of content out of their MMO, you should pick Maplestory. With multiple engaging storylines that vary in tone from hilarious to serious, events that are actually fun and useful, and some of the best character progression of any game, Maplestory truly delivers and doesn't stop.Many negative reviews say that this game is "pay to win" so that they can kill end game bosses... in Maplestory end game Chaos bosses aren't able to be done until level 180 to 200. During that time you can EASILY SOLO (by yourself) the Easy and Normal bosses to obtain armor. And seriously, the whole concept of Maplestory is not to be "get to level 200 and raid" like nearly EVERY OTHER MMO on the market that follows the whole World of Warcraft mentality... Maplestory's primary concept is in its name... A STORY. Maplestory has some of the BEST story telling of all time in any MMO that I have played. (WoW's story died passed Wrath... don't even talk to me about Blizzard being good story tellers anymore, cuz they're trash.) Each character you create in Maplestory tells a piece of the puzzle, adding more to the depth, lore, and reasoning as to why you exist in Maple world. And Nexon is ALWAYS making new quest lines to keep you actively engaged.Each character plays into one another's story and the more you play more characters the more you'll uncover about the game. Unlike in other MMOs where you follow the same quest line everytime you play the game, Maplestory has a VAST ARRAY of leveling areas and choices for you to play through when you make new characters. The game will not get boring quickly when you say "oh I've been here before" and even if you do follow the same path everytime you won't feel as though you're bogged down by slow experience. In truth, every character can hit level 100 within a week WITHOUT 2x experience.You'll be able to quickly create new characters, test their style, experience their story, and decide which one is right for you. Once you do find the character you want to play, you'll love the amount of character progress necessary to make your character one of a kind. Many of the negative reviewers feel that Maplestory is for some reason "get the best possible armor you can in the shortest amount of time so that you can do the same bosses over and over again..." No... that's WoW logic and that's weak... An MMO is supposed to be an engaging story that follows your character and your friends. Maplestory will deliver to you more than 6 months worth of content. Let's put it another way, even if you got to level 200 in a month (semi possible), you'd then have to get your first boss set (seeing that you won't be strong enough to kill any Chaos bosses). You'd then have to go back to do Normal and Easy mode bosses for money and their sets. (Poisonic weapons are level 110 weapons that give you 10% additional boss damage and you can start trying to get one at level 90.) The next is Necro at level 120, as well as Von Leon. Then once you are able, you start Root Abyss to get your level 130 set, or you can skip that set and move straight to the level 150 Tyrant armor. There is not one set path for you to take... this isn't WoW's dumb style of "do this tier first". It's what you make of it.

												Game does not even open.Edit: Hours of troubleshooting later, it started crying hacks..."Themida: A monitor program has been found running in your system. Please, unload it from memory and restart your..."Duck off! I only use basic IT tools like Process Monitor. Not hacks. And only to debug your stupid, error-riddled game that doesn't even show a proper error message (until now, that is). It just crashes to black screen over and over.And apparently the only way to unload my kernel hooks is a system reboot. (BSOD risk otherwise.) I'm not restarting my computer for this... I haven't rebooted in a month. Stupid anti-cheating false positives trying to kill my system uptime.Also, you should tell me WHICH of my dozen monitors and system tools scare you. None of them are hacks. So how am I supposed to know what exactly to disable? A good error message does not hide information. LIST all the supposed "monitor programs" you object to. By executable name, by the handles of the dll modules loaded in memory, by registry keys, or whatever you can do. Just help the poor user track down the culprit. What a stupid error message...Edit 2: A day later I got in. (Compatibility mode, manually downloading dll files, hex editing others, clean reboot, avoid using "monitors"; you really hate supporting the latest and greatest, don't you? Now I don't even have a reason to return to the game.
