content:
Posted: April 4
												So I got this game while I was looking for a new MMO to play. Big mistake. This is literally the worst MMORPG I have ever played in my life. If you're looking for a game to play, literally pick any other game and you'll have a more immersive experience. The gameplay is literally the most unimmersive thing ever. The monsters in this game literally just walk around, and when you touch them, you take damage. Sure, a few of them might have an attack or something, but they're generic, or undodgable, or both. They are generic and  have no counterplay and are just not fun to fight. As for your ability combos, they don't exist. You literally just spam the same thing over and over again, except for a few different characters, but even they just cast the same abilities in a loop over and over again. You also need to apply an excessive amount of buffs before you actually go and do stuff, and then you'd need to reapply them in a few minutes again, which I don't get the point of. The bossfights consist of undodgable attacks that will apply status effects for a few minutes at a time, usually a silence which would prevent you from using any skill at all, so you're just stuck there doing nothing, or you could be forced to move in a certain direction without warning. And because monsters deal touch damage in this game, it could make you ram into the boss and die. Teamwork is also not a part of the game at all, as the only healing class in the game has low demand, and small player base. Players will literally queue and then leave the party to fight solo. You are not reliant on healers, rather you gotta spend money to buy potions and chug them as you get hit by attacks you can't dodge. Heck, some bosses have a life counter because they know you're going to die from the lack of counterplay.The game will try to draw you in by giving you abilities that will unlock at higher levels, forcing you to grind mindlessly for long periods of time at the unimmersive mobs. Quests in this game all suck, they just involve picking stuff up or killing things and don't have a high enough reward to be worth doing.Once you get to higher levels, the game will try to appeal to you with excessive amounts of effects and 10 lines of damage numbers even though your attack only hits the enemy once. Then it becomes pay2win after that. You literally need to spend thousands of irl dollars in order to progress from that point on, or you won't be able to fight 90% of the bosses in the game. In addition, you also need to level several characters to a very high level in order to boost your main's stats, and that will take a long time PER CHARACTER. The gear progression is very linear, and everyone just wears the same stuff because it is the best. There aren't any items that are different from each other, so you can't experiment and do different kinds of builds.There are also no interesting places to explore, because it's a 2-D platformer game with no interesting scenery or terrain.Overall, this is a terrible game and literally play anything else other than this if you're looking for a new game to play. This game is just a massive, unimmersive grind just to see larger damage numbers.Oh, and the female characters are not heavily fanserviced. Literally unplayable.On a sidenote, I technically don't have this many hours in the game, because steam would think this game was open even though it was completely closed

number of helpful: 3 of 8 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 11, 2016
												At its current state, this game has a variety of core problems that likely aren't going to go away. Chief among them is weak servers, which causes lag to be a persistent problem throughout the duration of play - this alone makes the game hard to enjoy regardless of other mechanics. However, the pacing and world design are also a mess.My friends and I made it to level fifty in a single evening of playing, and in that time I don't believe any of us stopped to shop for equipment more than once. The sense of progression is hectic and explosive, and before we had time to get comfortable with our first job choices we were being asked to determine how we'd like to specialize into the next tier of job level. It seemed that among the basic "explorer" classes, "warrior" was objectively the best because it had the most HP and did approximately the same thing as all the other classes.But a bigger problem we discovered was trying to keep the group together. Maple Story doesn't seem to want you to explore its world or develop a lay of the land, because we were constantly being snagged by the collar and being teleported to the next quest location. This led to two of our players dropping out when quests flung them to far away places and they had no idea how to get back to us. One of them wound up in a high school, then had to abandon the party to "parachute over the beaches of Normandy" as he described it. We never saw him again.The main group eventually hit a dead end when all the local quests began to read as "low-level quests" because we'd been blowing up three levels at a time. At no point in the night had we properly explored anything, so when monsters began to fall behind us, we had no clue where to go to find monsters that weren't ten levels below us. We WERE able to find monsters twenty levels ahead of us, which we could kill, but there wasn't any worthwhile reward for the effort.Everything is cluttered and crammed in, from items on the ground, to the monsters, to the map, and Maple Story doesn't appear to have much respect for its artists. In a spastic mess of monsters dying by the thousands, occasionally the game will summon a larger version of a pre-existing game sprite, but it's clearly something nobody in the art department intended to let happen because the scaled up sprite is at too low a resolution. The big monsters are visibibly pixelated because of this obvious, clunk-headed, hilarious decision.It seems that at some point, Maple Story might have had a story, or the feel of one. There are numerous weapons and armors intended for low-level players that you'll never touch or even look at because you're moving too fast. The few quests there are wind up being too many because you pass them right away. In the end I don't know who these people are or why I should care about them because the entire Maple Story world feels two screens tall and four screens wide.At the end of the night, there was a unanimous consensus that Maple Story would be an "uninstall, never play again" type of game for our group. Whatever nostalgia people may have for what this game was ten years ago, there is not much meaningful content here to recommend to anyone now. At least not in the first fifty levels we cleared in a few hours! If it gets better, I can only wonder how much of the game is filler before it improves.

												One of the best begging simulators out on the market. You have no need for much money in this game but it doesn't stop you from asking for large amounts of it from strangers. Do you like being followed and constantly asked if you are single? Play a female character. It will increase your begging abilities ten fold as players will often simple walk up to and drop free items in order to impress you. As money serves no real purpose in this game for low levels, you can use your begging donations to create riots as you drop the money in extremely small quantities on the ground in crowded areas. Don't you worry, they will swarm on that money like flies on feces regardless of the amount of money.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2014
												I originally started playing MapleStory back in 2005 when there were only four classes. This MMO is heavily grind style oriented at it's core so if you're into party questing and a leveling addict then this game is one you should play. As a SSMMORPG the 2D aspect is a change from the normally 3D environment of most MMOs.I honestly don't know how I feel about the implementation of all the new icons that clutter the left side of the screen notifying you about a RIDICULOUS amount of things that never used to exist 'back in the day'. Also, it used to be a badge of honor to be lvl70+ (with the level cap being at 120 the last time I had played all those years ago). Now, coming back, all I had to do was grind within the span of 3 days and boom; lvl100. I'm honestly playing for the nostalgia kick.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2016
												I was never a fan of this game from day 1. My brother and 1 of my friends absolutely loved it, so that shows it's a hit or miss and is based solely on opinion. But that being said, this is my review for the game.I like the idea of a side scrolling RPG like this and I tend to play with friends on ANY and EVERY game that I can. So to start off it was fun and the idea of being our own things seems like hella fun. However, it doesn't get far with this concept as this game takes stupid amounts of grinding and hours from you. As if that's not bad enough from the start, add in the players farming the best exp areas to death taking from the ones who actually need it. Okay, so find a lesser people infested area. Easier said than done. If you do find an area with less players it's most likely because of the number of hackers in that area clearing mass mobs instantly. By the time you find yourself some exp to gain you only grind for a few hours before losing interest and logging. And of course there's only so many times you can do this before you quit all together. The graphics are a nice anime looking touch and it's pretty easy to find your friends. But unless you have 0 to do in your life and the #(*%#* tons of spare time needed to achieve anything don't bother.

content:
Posted: March 16
												It's an alright-like game, but not good.Of course, consider this review moot; however, I must leave a response via personal experience. This is.... well, just not a good game, personally. There's a few problems as of why. For one, there are a few problems with connecting account data from the original game itself to steam; data is seperate, there are possible ways around this and various people have explained the solution vs the problem, but I must mention that case as it is one thing which may throw the unwitty beginner off-course. For another, the player base.... they're actually a very unfriendly lot. Pull up a chair for me to explain the details? No? fair enough as that's a story which will not fit into this helpless viewpoint of a review but the players have destroyed any hope for socializing in this game for the life of me. Let's save that for another subject elsewhere. A third? Some computers may not exactly wish to take the game's standard resolution, of course however there are also various ways to counter this excuse of some constant "exe" failures but it must be noted.Side silly little pointless nitpicks: -medicore graphics, other games are better such as Elsword and so-on but others object, -good luck if you wander into the wrong place at the wrong time, little confused apprentace!  (in fact, this is the first game which taught me "Don't wander everywhere you please or you will die!" as a very hard and painful lesson which is yet to be forgotten),-some quests can become quite annoying, -again I emphasize: fans and players of this game, HOSTILE, HOSTILE, HOSTILE AS HELL (can be due to roleplaying as their character/s? and/or just downright bad people)-can get repetitive and stale very quickly, There are other games much better out there than this, and I'm aware that it has however been improving technically over the many years since my last visit of it by now; regardless, I'm strongly against it and do not quite recommend this for anyone to play, if not in fact considering it one of the top-10 worst games to be know (not the absolute worst though). You can go for it if you like, but this is my review as all. In the end result: your choice. Good luck if you do decide to go for this game.

content:
Posted: August 26, 2014
												9.4/10Maplestory is an old MMORPG game and it was one of the best 2-D games there was back then! Don't let my few my hours distract you as I played the game originally on it's launcher itself. Since it came on Steam, I hope to see memories. The game may be old and pretty useless today to many people, but it my pride, it is a good game. I played it back in 2006 and it was a very awesome game. Up to today, I wish to make this game once again popular like it was before. The present day is pretty boring now since there are more hackers coming in and it's very easy to level, but atleast they still update an old game. Though there is Cash Shop, this game is not a "Pay to Win" game at all. You choose to buy stuff there for pets and good looking clothes, but now they added more items that may seem like "Pay to Win," but it's not. This game is still worth playing, but there isn't much a friendly community like it was back then, but I don't care. I look forward into there games like I always do and they always get me addicted for many hours. The game has changed alot since Maplestory Big Bang earlier years before, but the game will never die with its' old nice music to listen to. It's great to keep on playing and have the memories back where you were at the first time you played this game. This game has never loss my respect over the years, because they still have the originals, and I like it. The game isn't what it was before that interested alot of people, but I'd recommend it.

												As a game I've been playing on and off for almost 10 years now. This game gives me an intense sense of nostalgia, seeing the game transform from a grindfest based on who had to no life, to a grindfest to see who has the most real money items really makes me miss the times where being level 30 was a big deal. Maplestory is still a good game, just be prepared for an elitist and toxic community on par with League of Legends and Dota2.

content:
Posted: January 4
												Game's okay 2/10Realistically, I really do love this game. I've played since closed beta and I always find myself coming back to it. There is one major problem though, Nexon America does a terrible job at maintaining the game. Maintenance hours will usually get extended. That is understandable. But what is inexcusable is how terrible the servers are. I have not had a day in the past month where I didn't disconnect fewer than eight times in a day. It is almost impossible to stay connected to the game. If there are days where I do stay connected, the game is extremely laggy and unresponsive. I find this unacceptable considering Nexon is a large company and the game has been around for over 10 years. Having stable servers should be a priority when hosting an online game. Until connectivity issues are fixed I cannot recommend this game to anyone. If I had to give this game a score on a scale of 1-10 it would be an 8 or a 9 but because I can't even stay connected long enough to play, I give it a 3-10

content:
Posted: March 8, 2014
												The game in general is not too bad. i played this game from the beginning with only the explorers, then stopped mid way. after going back to this game, the only bad thing i have to say is that its too easy. the classes are diverse and differnt, the animations look very impressive with each character skills, the sound/music is also not to bad either. The enviorment in the world of maplestory looks cool with alot of diverse monsters. speaking of monsters, the bosses and expedition bosses are hard, yet memorizing. yes, there has been alot of changes making this mmo easy and not as hard to lvl as before, but with a couple of friends, this isnt too bad. the controls and skill management is differnt then other mmos. for example some mmos uses the numbers, while in maplestory any button on your key can be used as an attack, potion, or other mangement. to me thats cool so its not so stiff and make it comforting to me. also the story is actual pretty in depth with every character they have and are introducing later on.still, the main quests are cool, but the quest around the world are pretty dull. most players grind in it, or do some party quests that are worth doing.also, dont judge this game becasue its 2D, because it really is a game full of experience and adventure. in the end, the pros are that the animations are cool, music and sound is cool, classes are pretty diverse and intresting, the enviroment looks fine for it being 2D, and the bosses are pretty impressive. cons are that its pretty easy, nobady really does the party quest, and the quests around the game is pretty boring. overall though, i would recommond this game.

content:
Posted: July 10, 2016
												After reading other reviews and trying the game for a few hours i found the sad hard truth the this once great game truely was destroyed by yet another cash hungry company that think like little kids and can't help but be jerks with all the power going to their heads.Leveling is insanely easy, i reached level 35 in a mere few minutes but am now currently stuck in an island after being teleported "For no apparent reason" about some quests whice i skipped through cause quite frankly, no one gives a ♥♥♥♥!, im only here to the serious main quest line not ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t side pieces of random mixed and matched jury rigged side ♥♥♥♥♥.With no explination to how to do anything remotely useful or generally not clear enough to understand i think i will continue hosting D&D games and use some of the content from this game and make proper use of it since i like the idea and want to use it.I feel like i truely missed something golden and have been left with the remains and i can't help but think of the happy memories many older maplers must of had, i wish i had been able to feel that for myself but it seems i came to late, the golden age is over.Most of the enemys are just reskins of each other and the worlds are so small its should have been an iphone game, picking up items is boring and takes forever, in whice enemys will respawn you will kill them and BOOM, more items, whice leads to an endless massive loot fix you will be sad to see as you are forced to eventully give up and leave most of it behind.I play Luminous, apparently a hero class whice i couldn't care less about since i ALWAYS play a sorcerer in any game i play, and i find most of the classes lacking or all feeling the same now.REGENS, oh ♥♥♥♥ don't get me started, you get 10 hp for standing still for 10 seconds, at level 20 you already have 2000 health, mana has a regen of 3 at 10 seconds, and my mana pool is already 7000, so im looking at 3 hours of standing still doing nothing for a near full regeneration. and iv heard mages mana pools go up to 30.000 to 50.000 near high levels, but regens don't increase to conpensate for this, there all fixed numbers instead of percentages, a very poor and lazy mechanic that any dev should be ashamed of.And on the final note a word to Wizet, you should have fought harder for your truely great game, my disapointment in you will never die or fade away, your a weak company and you should have been stronger, hurry up and get stronger and take your game back.

content:
Posted: November 18, 2016
												I used to play this game years ago and when I found out it was still going with a strong player base, I wanted to try it out again. The latest update also sounded amazing.Unfortunately, I cannot play it. It won't load up. After uninstalling and reinstalling it, I was finally able to create an account to play with. However, the uninstall and reinstall didn't help with actually starting the game. It won't load up.All I get is the screen saying the game is starting. I get the security logo, then it disappears and soon after the loading screen disappears and I'm back in the steam page saying it's "ready to play".I've added it to my security exceptions, to my firewall, to my antivirus. Still won't run.I have no issues with any of my other games on steam, only MapleStory. Maybe this is a bug with the latest update. But there isn't any news about it anywhere I can find, especially here on steam. So, I thought I'd save other people the trouble and write this so other people don't waste 3-5 hours of their time trying to get it to run.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 23, 2015
												I have played this game when I was younger, but one "feature" of it that I had forgotten about is rollback.After staying up until the wee hours of the morning playing, I, rather than logging out, had exited the game by closing the window. Bad choice.Maplesotry will /not/ save data locally - it will save it to their servers. Furthermore, this means that there is no autosave feature, you must manually preform a transaction within the game in order to trigger a save.Yes, I am salty and my review of the game will be effected by that, but Maplestory, from the very start, feels like what it is. Archaic. Big numbers for damage, lengthy grinds, enemies that are way too weak or way too strong.There will be another broken class, there will be a king of every scoreboard, and to even dream of hitting even close to the ranking or even just the position they are at in the game is unfathomable without obscene amounts of playtime.This game's appeal lies firmly in nonstalgia. If you've played this game in the past, then by all means, indulge. It's cute, it's fun in the moment, it's something to kill time with. They even have a class that immediatley starts you out as the equivalent of a dragon-winged sailor moon. But with the excruciating number of classes and areas and (in my thick-skulled opinion) VERY convoluted menues and maps - It might be better to go somewhere else for an MMORPG.I'll end with a quote from my skype group chat:"This game looks like trashRunescape looks betterI'm gonna go play Runescape"(Beware of games beaten out by Runescape.)
